intro: Primulina tribracteata var. tribracteata, commonly known as the velvetleaf streptocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Due to its ornamental value, it is popular among succulent and tropical plant enthusiasts.
